interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Poly Nail Gel Kit, 7 Colors Nail Extension Gel with UV Lamp, Poly Extension Decoration Kit, Base Top Coat Set with Rhinestone, Nail Molds, Nail Art Gel Kits for Home DIY Manicure, Blue Nude Series Review Date: 2020/09/20 Store: AIFAIFA Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Color': 'Blue', 'Material': 'Acrylic', 'Brand': 'AIFAIFA', 'Item Form': 'Gel', 'Product Dimensions': '5.9 x 5.9 x 5.9 inches; 1.48 Pounds'} Review Text: To start with: this is an actual great little starter kit. This offers people the opportunity to play with both gel and polygel, while coming with a small light. Being honest - when I first started working with gel I wasn't sure if I liked it or not, so a kit like this would have been super helpful.

The gels themselves have nice self leveling. The colors are nicely pigmented two coaters. They are fairly tacky, so make sure you put on a top coat (which I always recommend) or be prepared to wipe down with alcohol. They do take a bit longer to set, but they do set nicely.

The sequins are a nice touch, and the top coat and base coats are very close quality to others I have (similar to Beetles). The top coat isn't quite a no wipe, but it shines up beautifully with a little bit of alcohol.

The tools are perfect, and the polygel colors are beautiful. They set nicely, and file perfectly. The duoforms are in lots of good sizes, so I don't have any issues finding the perfect sizes (my hands are weird, each finger has different size which is annoying to need 10 different sizes, but hey.

I don't quite understand why there's the nail foils since there's no glue for the foils. The top coat isn't quite tacky enough for foils. The striping tape is a very nice touch.

The light works fairly well. The onyl problem is its a one button, so its only 45 seconds or 60 seconds. I have a lot of other lights, so while I was happy to try this one out, and it'll be great for travel, I like my bigger lights for other daily use.

Overall, this is a great little kit for trying out gels and polygels. I would advise that you pick up more files and a bigger light in the future with more settings and timers, but overall, this is great for getting started. The travel case fits everything nicely, and makes it convenient to take on vacation. The gels also last about 2 weeks which is a huuuuuge plus. Review Title: Great beginner sets! Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** DIY nail art and manicures, hands-on craft activities, particularly exploring gel and polygel techniques.
- **Product Preferences:** Prefers starter kits that include comprehensive tools and materials, including user-friendly light devices, to facilitate experimentation.
- **Color Preference:** Enjoys a range of colors, particularly blue, along with pink and shimmery finishes.
- **Quality Expectation:** Values self-leveling products with good pigmentation and effective, versatile tools. Considers convenience and portability, favoring travel-friendly designs.
- **Usability:** Looks for user-friendly products that ease the learning curve, while also being aware of product limitations and enhancements needed as skills develop.
- **Experience Level:** Intermediate, as indicated by the desire for starter kits that also suggest upgrades for future use, including improved lighting options.
- **Functionality:** Seeks additional features, such as multiple light settings for curing, while appreciating tools that perform well and fit into a compact travel case.

**Overall Trends:** The user continues to appreciate value-driven products that enhance their nail art experience, focusing on functionality, ease of use, and skill development. The recent engagement indicates a broader exploration of colors and techniques, reinforcing the desire for practical tools and kits that support both beginner experimentation and future growth.
